info.name: Sunbird-ED-Portal-Form-Config-V1.0.1
info.description:
This document provides an overview of the form configurations for the Sunbird ED portal. Configuring these forms will allow you to set up user onboarding, home page, user profiles, dashboards, help centers, groups, certificates, et cetera.

## **Before you begin**

Here are a few points to remember while reading the document:

1. This document shows the preferred steps of the configuration. However, you can configure them independently unless specifically mentioned.
    
2. The type, action, subtype, and component are the mandatory metadata to create or read the API. It is advised not to change the key and value
    
3. This document contains the mandatory and optional forms
    
    1. Forms with _M as a suffix in their title are mandatory forms
        
    2. Forms with _O as a suffix in their title are optional forms
        
4. Mandatory forms have to be configured in the same steps as defined in the document.
    
5. Post created form data will be stored in Cassandra database.
    

## **Overview**

- **What is form config?**
    
    - Form config refers to a set of specifications, parameters that define the structure and behavior of a form in a web application .
        
- **Why are they required or used?**
    
    - It reduces the code dependency by decoupling form logic from the main application code. This leads to a more maintainable, modular, and flexible codebase.
        
- **How user can create their own form config?**
    
    - Please Refer this [link](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/25186239/2s93Y2TNAw) to create a new form.
        
- **How to Automate portal form config?**
    
    - Mandatory forms
        
        - Step 1: set **onlyMandatory** environment variable to **true**
            
        - Step 2: Run the collection - if flag is true it will execute and configure the mandatory form only.
            
    - All forms
        
        - Step 1: set **onlyMandatory** environment variable to **false**
            
        - Step 2: Run the collection - if flag is false it will execute and configure the all the forms.
            

## Categories of Sunbird ED Portal Form Configuration

1. Pre-Launched Forms
    
2. Home Page Forms
    
3. Profile Forms
    
4. Program Dashboard Forms
    
5. Groups
    
6. Help
    
7. Certificate Forms
    
8. Others

item.name: Pre-Launched-Forms
To exclude onboarding popup_O

request.description:
- "action": "get": Indicates that the action to be performed is related to retrieving or accessing data.
- "fields": Specifies the fields or URLs that are being requested.
    - Within the "fields" array, there are five strings representing URLs:
        - "/certs/": Represents the URL for accessing certificates.
        - "/signup/": Represents the URL for the signup page.
        - "/recover/": Represents the URL for the password recovery page.
        - "/sign-in/": Represents the URL for the sign-in page.
        - "/get/dial/": Represents the URL for accessing the dial endpoint.

response.name: Form Read (user__onboarding__exclusion)

item.description: When the user first enters the URL, by default, the onboarding popup appears on the screen. Refer to the below screenshot. To exclude the onboarding popup appearing on every screen, this form is configured. This form serves the purpose of excluding the onboarding popup based on the route path. Specifically, if the URL contains certain routes such as "/certs/", "/signup/", or "/recover/", the onboarding popup should not be displayed. In the below screenshot, the onboarding popup is not displayed on the screen after configuring this form. **\*Impact:** The onboarding popup will appear on the portal routes screen such as /signup,/cert,/faq, etc.

item.name: To give the name to the framework categories_M

request.description:
- "defaultLanguage": "en": Indicates that the default language for the framework categories is English.
- "en": Specifies the translations for the framework categories in English.
    - "frameworkCategory1": "Board": Represents the first framework category, which is typically related to educational boards.
    - "frameworkCategory2": "Medium": Represents the second framework category, which often refers to the medium or language of instruction.
    - "frameworkCategory3": "Grade": Represents the third framework category, which pertains to the academic grade or level.
    - "frameworkCategory4": "Subject": Represents the fourth framework category, which focuses on specific subjects or disciplines.

response.name: Form Read (customResourcebundles__list__global)

item.description: This Form is used to update the label name of framework category terms that are used in the portal. "en" is used as a default language for translation. Refer to the below screenshot. **\*Impact:** If this form is not configured correctly, the label name will not update for the framework category terms that are used in the portal. Refer to the below screenshots:

item.name: To show/hide the new onboarding popup_O

request.description:
"shownewUserOnboarding": "true": Specifies the configuration for showing new user onboarding. The value "true" indicates that the new user onboarding feature should be enabled.

**\*Impact :: no impact**

response.name: Form Read (newUserOnboarding__onboarding__global)

item.description: This form controls the visibility of the new onboarding popup.

item.name: To retrieve different language JSON files_O

request.description:
- "templateName": "collectionResourceBundles": Specifies the template name as "collectionResourceBundles," indicating that it is a configuration related to resource bundles for collections.
- "action": "list": Indicates that the action to be performed is to list the resource bundles.
- "fields": Contains an array of field configurations for resource bundles.
- "textbook": Represents the field code or identifier for the textbook resource bundle.
- "trackable": Contains a mapping of language codes to the corresponding trackable resource bundle filenames. Each language code is associated with a JSON file that contains labels or translations for the trackable resources related to the textbook.
- "nontrackable": Contains a mapping of language codes to the corresponding non-trackable resource bundle filenames. Similar to "trackable," each language code is associated with a JSON file that contains labels or translations for the non-trackable resources related to the textbook.
- "key": "tbk": Specifies the key or identifier for the textbook resource bundle.

response.name: Form Read (generaliseresourcebundles__list__global)

item.description:
This form is used to retrieve different language JSON files for both trackable and non-trackable contents.

**\*Impact:** If this form is not configured, then the labels will not appear properly.

item.name: To support language translations_O

request.description:
- "templateName": "defaultTemplate": Specifies the template name as "defaultTemplate," indicating that it is a configuration for a default template.
- "action": "search": Indicates that the action to be performed is a search operation.
- "fields": Contains an array of field configurations.
- "code": "portalLanguage": Represents the code or identifier for the field.
- "dataType": "text": Specifies the data type of the field as text.
- "name": "Portal Language": Provides the name or title for the field.
- "label": "Portal Language": Specifies the label for the field.
- "description": "Language that should be displayed on the portal (Like English, Hindi, etc)": Provides a description of the field, explaining its purpose.
- "editable": true: Indicates that the field is editable.
- "inputType": "select": Specifies that the input type for the field is a select dropdown.
- "required": false: Indicates that the field is not required to be filled.
- "displayProperty": "Editable": Specifies the display property of the field as editable.
- "visible": true: Indicates that the field is visible.
- "renderingHints": { "semanticColumnWidth": "four" }: Provides rendering hints to determine the layout or column width of the field.
- "range": Represents the available options for the select dropdown.
- English:
    - "value": "en": Represents the value for the English language option.
    - "label": "English": Specifies the label for the English language option.
    - "dir": "ltr": Indicates the text direction as left-to-right.
    - "accessibleText": "English": Provides an accessible text description for the English language option.
- Kannada:
    - "value": "kn": Represents the value for the Kannada language option.
    - "label": "": Specifies the label for the Kannada language option.
    - "dir": "ltr": Indicates the text direction as left-to-right.
    - "accessibleText": "Kannada": Provides an accessible text description for the Kannada language option.

response.name: Form Read (content__search__resourcebundle)

item.description: The Form is used to support the different language translations in the drop-down menu of the portal. **\*Impact:** If this form is not configured correctly, then the user cannot view other language options in the drop-down menu apart from the default language (English).

The below screenshot shows "guest-img1.svg" image is used for the "Teacher" profile. **\*Impact:** If this form is not configured, then the user type popup is not displayed, and the user type selection and location screen will be skipped during user onboarding. item.description: This form is designed to provide a framework for selecting educational categories such as board, medium, class, and subject. Each category has a code, label, name, and description. **\*Impact**: If the form is not configured, then on selection of the board, the API will fail to get the values for medium and grade. The popup will be closed and the user will be redirected to the landing page with the below error message.

item.name: On load of location selection popup_O

request.description:
- "code": A code or identifier for the field, set as "name".
- "type": Specifies the type of the field, which is "input" in this case.
- "templateOptions": An object containing various options related to the template or layout of the field.
- "labelHtml": Specifies the HTML contents for the label of the field. It includes a placeholder "$0" that will be replaced with the value "Name". Additionally, it adds a span element with a CSS class to display a required asterisk symbol.
- "hidden": A boolean value indicating whether the field should be hidden (set as true).
- "placeHolder": Specifies the placeholder text to be displayed within the input field, set as "Enter Name".
- "multiple": A boolean value indicating whether multiple values can be entered in the field (set as false).
- "validations": An array containing validation rules for the field. In this case, there is a single validation rule of type "required", indicating that the field must have a value.

response.name: Form Read (profileConfig_v2__get__default)

item.description: This Form is used to display the location values in the drop-down list while user onbaording. This is a form configuration for a select field that allows users to choose a state from a list. Here are some ways in which a user can improvise this form configuration and use it according to their convenience: 1\. **Change the field type**: The user can change the **type** field from "select" to other types such as "radio", "checkbox", or "text" based on their requirements. 2\. **Modify the label and placeholder text**: The user can modify the "_label Html_" and "placeHolder" fields to change the label and placeholder text of the selected field. In this example, the label is "State" with an asterisk to indicate it is a required field, and the placeholder text is "Select State". The user can customize these values as per their needs. 3\. **Customize the data source**: The user can customize the "dataSrc" field to change the data source for the selected field. In this example, the data source is specified using "marker" and "params". The user can modify these values to use a different data source or provide additional parameters for the existing data source. 4\. **Add or modify validation rules**: The user can add or modify the validation rules specified in the **validations** field. In this example, the only validation rule is to check if the field is required. The user can add other validation rules such as minimum and maximum length, regular expressions, or custom validation functions to ensure data integrity. Overall, this form configuration provides a lot of flexibility and customization options for users to tailor the select field to their specific needs and preferences. The values from the response can be taken as labels in the form and can be altered and used as per the user's requirements. **\*Impact:** If the form is not configured, the location dropdown will not appear.

item.name: To fetch user feed data if user is custodian as well as logged in_O

request.description:
- code: A code or identifier for the field, set as "externalIdVerificationLabels".
- name: The name given to the field, set as "externalIdVerification".
- headerLabel: The label for the header or question related to the field, set as "Are you a government school teacher?".
- fieldLabel: The label for the input field where the user needs to enter their teacher ID for verification, set as "Enter your teacher ID for verification".
- popupHeaderLabel: The label for a popup or dialog related to user verification, set as "User Verification".
- verificationSuccessfulLabel: The label displayed when the teacher's profile is successfully verified, set as "Teacher profile verified successfully".
- incorrectIDLabel: The label displayed when the entered ID is incorrect and the user needs to enter it again, set as "The ID entered is incorrect. Enter the ID again".
- verificationFailureLabel: The label displayed when the teacher's profile could not be verified due to an incorrect ID, set as "Could not verify teacher profile as the ID entered is incorrect".

response.name: Form Read (user__onboarding_externalIdVerification)_M

item.description: This form will provide the label for custodian and logged user to use.

Pre-launched forms are also the onboarding forms of the application. When a user visits the portal URL, the pre-launched forms are called.

**They are mainly used to configure:**

1. To exclude the onboarding popup
2. Label names & define the framework categories
3. Flag to show and hide the onboarding popup
4. To set the different language JSON of the application
5. To support different languages for translation
6. UserType onboarding popup
7. Board selection for the framework categories
8. Location onboarding popup
9. User feed data if user is custodian

item.name: Home Page Forms
To configure homepage cateogory and label_O

request.description:
- "fields": An object containing field configurations.
- "cbse": Represents the "cbse" attribute.
- "teacher": Represents the "teacher" sub-attribute under "cbse".
- The "teacher" sub-attribute contains an array of objects with different properties.
- "name": Specifies the name of the teacher sub-attribute. In this case, there are two objects with names "observation" and "project".
- "icon": An object that defines the icons associated with the teacher sub-attribute.
- "web": Specifies the web URL or file path for the icon associated with the teacher sub-attribute.
- "app": Specifies the app URL or file path for the icon associated with the teacher sub-attribute.

response.name: Form Read (category__homeListing__targetedCategory)

item.description: **category__homeListing__targetedCategory_O** The form configuration contains a category-based selection component with a targeted category subtype. The response data specifies different categories and their associated subcategories. The category and subcategory names are used as labels in the "Browse Other Categories" section of the component. In the Browse Other Categories section of the home page, the labels are given using this configuration. Users can customize these labels to better suit their needs. **\*Impact:** If this Form configuration is not used, the Browse Other Categories option will be removed from the home page

request.description:
- "fields": An array that specifies the fields to be included in the search.
- "index": An index value associated with the search.
- "search": An object containing the search settings and configurations.
- "contentType": Specifies the type of content for the search.
- "title": The title or label associated with the search.
- "default": Indicates whether this search configuration is the default option.
- "isEnabled": Specifies whether the search functionality is enabled.
- "anonymousUserRoute": Specifies the route and query parameter for anonymous users.
- "loggedInUserRoute": Specifies the route and query parameter for logged-in users.
- "filter": Specifies the filter settings for the search.
- "theme": Defines the visual theme or styling for the search.
- "desc": A description or label associated with the search.
- "metaData": Contains the metadata . It also contains the **searchFilterConfig** which helps in customising the search filter for the respective tab

item.description: This form: - Displays or hides the menu bar and tab within the landing page section - Incorporates the filter configurations that are based on the selected tab **\*Impact:** If this form is not used, the menu bar is removed on the home page and the user cannot perform any action or navigate anywhere in the application.

item.name: To configure banner and notification in home page_O

request.description:
- "commandId": A numerical identifier for the command, set as 1619548200000.
- "commandType": Specifies the type of command, which is "SEGMENT_COMMAND" in this case.
- "controlFunction": Indicates the control function associated with the command, set as "LOCAL_NOTIF".
- "expiresAfter": Represents the expiration time of the command, specified as 1841807258000.
- "tagCriteria": Specifies the criteria for tag filtering, set as "AND" in this case.
- "tagFilterUpto": This property appears to be null, indicating no specific limit on tag filtering.
- "tagFilters": An array of tag filters, in this case containing a single filter "USERLANG_en" indicating the English language.
- "targetDeviceIds": This property appears to be null, indicating no specific target devices for the notification.
- "targetVersion": This property also appears to be null, indicating no specific target version for the notification.
- "controlFunctionPayload": An array containing the payload for the control function, which is an object with various properties related to the local notification functionality.
    - "code": A code or identifier for the control function, set as "localNotification".
    - "name": The name of the control function, set as "LocalNotification".
    - "type": Specifies the type of the control function, set as 1.
    - "config": An array containing the configuration settings for the local notification.
        - msg": The message to be displayed in the notification, set as "Welcome! You've chosen English".
        - "isEnabled": Specifies whether the notification is enabled or not, set as true.
        - "id": An identifier for the notification, set as 1005.
        - "title": The title of the notification, set as "Welcome! You've chosen English".

response.name: Form Read (config__get__segmentation_v2)

item.description: This form is used to create segmentation for notifications and banners to targeted users. For instance, if the user has selected State as Tamil Nadu, Medium as English, and Grade as Class 5, then for this preference, the banners and notifications are shown accordingly to the user. **\*Impact:** In the absence of this form, the Feature section (Banner card list) will be removed from the Explore page

item.name: To configure metadata of content and collection_M

request.description:
- "name": Represents the name of the content.
- "code": Specifies a code associated with the content.
- "createdOn": Indicates the date and time when the content was created.
- "lastUpdatedOn": Represents the date and time of the last update made to the content.
- "status": Represents the status of the content.
- "channel": Specifies the channel associated with the content.
- "mimeType": Indicates the MIME type of the content.
- "gradeLevel": Specifies the grade level associated with the content.
- "subject": Represents the subject of the content.
- "board": Specifies the education board associated with the content.
- "contentType": Represents the type of content.
- "resourceType": Specifies the resource type of the content.
- "keywords": Indicates the keywords associated with the content.
- "language": Represents the language of the content.
- "medium": Specifies the medium of instruction for the content.
- "thumbnail": Represents the thumbnail image associated with the content.
- "downloadUrl": Specifies the URL for downloading the content.
- "author": Represents the author of the content.
- "publisher": Specifies the publisher of the content.
- "license": Indicates the license under which the content is published.
- "subjectIds": Represents the IDs of the subjects associated with the content.
- "gradeLevelIds": Specifies the IDs of the grade levels associated with the content.
- "boardIds": Indicates the IDs of the education boards associated with the content.
- "primaryCategory": Represents the primary category of the content.
- "additionalCategories": Specifies additional categories associated with the content.
- "plugins": Indicates the plugins associated with the content.
- "maxAttempts": Specifies the maximum number of attempts allowed for the content.
- "learningOutcome": Represents the learning outcome associated with the content.
- "displayScore": Specifies whether to display the score for the content.
- "batches": Indicates the batches associated with the content.
- "year": Specifies the year associated with the content.

item.description: **schemas__get__search** This form is used to configure the metadata of content and collection. It is used to call when the user clicks the **All** tab or performs a global search to explore the content to consume. **\*Impact:** If this form is not used, the global search and **All** tab feature will not work.

item.name: To configure the player to be used in portal_O

request.description:
- Video Player:
    - "type": "video-player": Indicates that this field represents a video player.
    - "version": 2: Specifies the version of the video player.
    - "mimeType": \["video/mp4", "video/webm"\]: Specifies the supported MIME types for video content, which are "video/mp4" and "video/webm".
- PDF Player:
    - : "type": "pdf-player": Indicates that this field represents a PDF player.
    - "version": 2: Specifies the version of the PDF player.
    - "mimeType": \["application/pdf"\]: Specifies the supported MIME type for PDF content, which is "application/pdf".
- EPUB Player:
    - "type": "epub-player": Indicates that this field represents an EPUB player.
    - "version": 2: Specifies the version of the EPUB player.
    - "mimeType": \["application/epub"\]: Specifies the supported MIME type for EPUB content, which is "application/epub".
- QUML Player:
    - "type": "quml-player": Indicates that this field represents a QUMC player.
    - "version": 2: Specifies the version of the QUMC player.
    - "threshold": 3: Specifies a threshold value for the QUMC player.
    - "mimeType": \["application/vnd.sunbird.questionset"\]: Specifies the supported MIME type for QUMC content, which is "application/vnd.sunbird.questionset".

response.name: Form Read (content__play__player)

item.description: The form is used to provide the basic config of a player to be used in the portal. The appropriate player will be selected and opened, based on the content type. Users can customize the player form by modifying the values of the fields or by adding new fields to meet their specific requirements. **\*Impact:** If this form is not configured, the old player will load by default.

item.name: To configure the drop-down value in course dashboard report_O

request.description:
- lang_key: A language key or identifier for the field, set as "frmelmnts.lbl.progressExhaustReport".
- encrypt: A boolean value indicating whether encryption is enabled for the field, set as "false".
- title: The title or label for the field, set as "Course progress exhaust".
- dataset: The dataset associated with the field, set as "progress-exhaust".

response.name: Form Read (batch__list__report_types)

item.description: This form is used to configure the report type value in the dropdown. The below screenshot displays the label and drop-down values respectively. **\*Impact:** If the form is not configured, the dropdown will not be shown for the report (Choose your report)

item.name: To configure the feedback options on completion of a content_O

response.name: Form Read (contentfeedback__get__en)

item.description: This Form is used to show feedback options on the player once the user consumes any content. Based on their needs, users can modify the content data, such as subjective feedback, using this API call. **\*Impact:** The absence of this form will not allow adding subjective feedback once the rating is given.

These forms are called when the user lands on the home page of the application. They are used to configure:

- Homlisting feature on the home page
- The menubar tab
- Banner feature on the home page
- Search content schemas in all tab
- MimeType of player to be used
- Drop-down filter to show the report
